newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee closes stable in kerb, seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee closes stable in kerb, seen steady.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed unchanged at 39.30 to the dollar in the kerb market on Wednesday after the State (central) Bank of Pakistan denied rumours of a possible devaluation, dealers said.
The rupee was likely to open steady on Thursday after the denial by bank officials, one dealer said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate was unchanged at 35.6200/35.7981 rupees to the dollar set on August 29.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed unchanged at 10 percent. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
